intro: Leptocionium serrulatum, commonly known as the serrated bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibacillaceae. It is characterized by its tiny, bladder-like structures that trap small organisms, aiding in its nutrient acquisition. The plant typically grows in freshwater environments such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Its leaves are simple and often have serrated edges, contributing to its common name. Leptocionium serrulatum is an important component of aquatic ecosystems, supporting diverse microfauna and contributing to water filtration.
